page.title: 07WOODFORD COTTAGE INDUSTRY
page.content: Some months ago a man started a cottage industry in the village. He makes wooden garden furniture. He is using a disused building (previously the village smithy for several hundred years) which is near the main road. Inside his tiny building there are planks of wood leaning against the walls. He buys the pine wood from Southampton and takes about ten days to make small garden tables, chairs, benches and picnic tables. All this is done by himself and another man, using an electric saw. While they are working there is a pleasant smell of sawdust. This wooden furniture is treated so that it can be left out in all weathers.
